definition: to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
many/much/often/a lot of/numerous/more/in excess/how (to what extent)/multi-/Taiwan pr. [duo2] when it means "how"

sentences.english: He was well informed and updated with all kinds of current affairs.
sentences.chinese: 他見多識廣，並且瞭解各種最新的時事新聞。

sentences.english: you know, the apartments are big, and the doormen are very, very nice and very informed.
sentences.chinese: 這裏的公寓很大，門衛都很好，也很見多識廣的。

sentences.english: The next difficulty level entailed trying to catch the more clued -up, older gulls.
sentences.chinese: 接下來的一級難度是抓住見多識廣的老海鷗。

sentences.english: Freelancers oftentimes have a broad spectrum of knowledge which can be helpful to others.
sentences.chinese: 自由職業者往往見多識廣，這一點對別人很有用。

sentences.english: As a merchant, he was a man of the world -- he had seen it all.
sentences.chinese: 他是一個見多識廣的商人。

sentences.english: You have a lot of experience. You have been to a lot of places.
sentences.chinese: 你去過很多地方，應該算是見多識廣了。

sentences.english: The cobblestones of Paris have seen some things.
sentences.chinese: 巴黎的鵝卵石可謂見多識廣。

sentences.english: Become an informed consumer, and you will increase your value to your organization.
sentences.chinese: 成爲一名見多識廣的客戶，會增加您在團隊中的價值。

definition: to harbor evil designs/to harbor malicious intentions
to show respect from a distance (idiom)/to remain at a respectful distance
to gesticulate/to point out/to point the finger of blame
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
to tell the truth/to tell it as it is
lit. a deluge of heavenly flowers (idiom)/fig. extravagant embellishments/hype
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
